analyzed: nad kyis lus zad de gong ma dang kha zas bcad dam ma chud dam /
translated: or as if one's body is exhausted by disease and one has stopped or not taken the above [medicine],

original: glo 'grams te rdol tam /
analyzed: glo 'grams te rdol tam /
translated: or as if one has a cough or a split [in the body],

original: sman tshabs chen por gyur pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ba la skyigs bu yong ba de lta bus btab na gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sman tshabs chen por gyur pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ba la skyigs bu yong ba de lta bus btab na gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: or as if one has taken a very strong medicine. If hiccups occur in any of these cases, they are incurable.

original: yang na nad do cog gis kyang ma rungs par ni byed mod kyi /
analyzed: yang na nad do cog gis kyang ma rungs par ni byed mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, any disease can make one unfit,

original: skyigs bu ltar myur du ma rungs par byed pa nyid ma yin no ;
analyzed: skyigs bu ltar myur du ma rungs par byed pa nyid ma yin no ;
translated: but it is not as quickly unfit as hiccups.

original: / skyigs bu dang dbugs mi bde ba'i nad gnyis ni nam 'chir nye ba'i tshe na 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / skyigs bu dang dbugs mi bde ba'i nad gnyis ni nam 'chir nye ba'i tshe na 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Both hiccups and dyspnea occur when one is close to death.

original: dbugs mi bde ba'i nad thabs dang / skyigs bu'i nad thabs bshad pa ste le'u bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbugs mi bde ba'i nad thabs dang / skyigs bu'i nad thabs bshad pa ste le'u bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter on the treatment of asthma and hiccups.

original: // / glo gcod chen po lus kyi srog zungs zad par byed @109b pa'i nad gzhi'i le'u lnga pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / glo gcod chen po lus kyi srog zungs zad par byed @109b pa'i nad gzhi'i le'u lnga pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: Chapter Five: The Treatment of Pthisis

original: zad byed kyi nad glo gcod zhes bya ba 'di phyi bzhin nang du 'ong zhing 'brang ngo //
analyzed: zad byed kyi nad glo gcod zhes bya ba 'di phyi bzhin nang du 'ong zhing 'brang ngo //
translated: Pthisis, which is called “the great wasting disease,” follows one from the outside and comes from within.

original: nad mang po kun gyi thog mar 'gro bas na de'i phyir 'di'i ming ni nad gnod pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: nad mang po kun gyi thog mar 'gro bas na de'i phyir 'di'i ming ni nad gnod pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bya /
translated: Because it precedes all other diseases, it is also called “the king of all diseases.”

original: lus zad par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: lus zad par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called “the disease that exhausts the body.”

original: lus skems par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: lus skems par byed pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called “the disease that dries up the body.”

original: nad kyi rgyal po zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: nad kyi rgyal po zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called “the king of diseases.”

original: nad 'di gna' dang po ni rgyu skar rnams dang bram ze rnams la glo gcong gis 'debs pa'i rgyal por gyur pas na de'i phyir nad 'di la ming gnod pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: nad 'di gna' dang po ni rgyu skar rnams dang bram ze rnams la glo gcong gis 'debs pa'i rgyal por gyur pas na de'i phyir nad 'di la ming gnod pa'i rgyal po zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Because this disease was originally the king of the diseases that afflicted the stars and the Brahmins, it is also called “the king of diseases.”

original: sman yang zad /
analyzed: sman yang zad /
translated: The medicine is also exhausted.

original: lus kyang zad par byed pas na glo gcod zad byed ces kyang bya /
analyzed: lus kyang zad par byed pas na glo gcod zad byed ces kyang bya /
translated: Since it also exhausts the body, it is called “consumption.”

original: mi'i bcud dang sha khrag la sogs pa skems par byed pas na glo gcod skems byed ces kyang bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i bcud dang sha khrag la sogs pa skems par byed pas na glo gcod skems byed ces kyang bya'o //
translated: Since it dries up the human essence, flesh, blood, and so on, it is also called “consumption.”

original: nad de dag gi nad nas rgyal po ltar gyur pas na rgyal po zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: nad de dag gi nad nas rgyal po ltar gyur pas na rgyal po zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Since it acts like a king among diseases, it is called “king.”

original: de la glo gcod skems byed kyi nad kyang rnam pa 'di bzhi gang yang rung ba las nad du gyur te /
analyzed: de la glo gcod skems byed kyi nad kyang rnam pa 'di bzhi gang yang rung ba las nad du gyur te /
translated: The disease of consumption is any of the following four types of disease.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: stobs kyi tshan gyis mi nus bzhin du nyams mthu gtugs te /
analyzed: stobs kyi tshan gyis mi nus bzhin du nyams mthu gtugs te /
translated: The first is when one is unable to bear the force of the disease, but one’s strength is exhausted and one acts violently.

original: chad chad du drag shul byas pa lta bu'am bshad gci 'ong bar gyur na brnags te bkag pa'am bud med la drags te khu ba zad pa dang / mdangs zad pa dang ; khong na snum yod pa zad pa dang / spyir khams bdun po zad pa dang /
analyzed: chad chad du drag shul byas pa lta bu'am bshad gci 'ong bar gyur na brnags te bkag pa'am bud med la drags te khu ba zad pa dang / mdangs zad pa dang ; khong na snum yod pa zad pa dang / spyir khams bdun po zad pa dang /
translated: The second is when one is constipated or has diarrhea, or when one is pregnant and suppresses the urge to urinate or defecate, or when one is exhausted from having sex with a woman, or when one’s semen is exhausted, or when one’s complexion is exhausted, or when the oil in one’s body is exhausted, or when the seven bodily constituents in general are exhausted.

original: zas skom sngon ma zos pa za ba'i cho ga bzhin du ma zos pa rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yang rung ba las nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas skom sngon ma zos pa za ba'i cho ga bzhin du ma zos pa rnam pa 'di lta bu gang yang rung ba las nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just like the ritual of eating food and drink that has not been eaten before, any of these types of food and drink that have not been eaten before can cause illness.

original: de ltar nang du gyur pa'i rgyu bzhi lta bu'i rlung nad dang mkhris pa'i nad dang bad kan gyi nad bslangs nas lus thams cad dang / rus pa'i tshigs thams cad kyi nang du nad zhugs nas de nas rtsa thams cad du gyes te 'phros nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang du gyur pa'i rgyu bzhi lta bu'i rlung nad dang mkhris pa'i nad dang bad kan gyi nad bslangs nas lus thams cad dang / rus pa'i tshigs thams cad kyi nang du nad zhugs nas de nas rtsa thams cad du gyes te 'phros nas /
translated: Thus, having stirred up the wind, bile, and phlegm disorders that are the four internal causes, the illness enters the entire body and all the joints of the bones. Then, having split apart and spread out through all the channels,

original: rtsa chen po bcu'i nang du nad zhugs nas yang na ni rtsa de rnams kyi sgo 'gags par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtsa chen po bcu'i nang du nad zhugs nas yang na ni rtsa de rnams kyi sgo 'gags par 'gyur /
translated: the illness enters the inside of the ten great channels. Then, either the doors of those channels become blocked,

original: yang na ni rtsa de rnams kyi sgo 'bye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na ni rtsa de rnams kyi sgo 'bye bar 'gyur /
translated: or the doors of those channels become open.

original: de bzhin du ro stod dang / ro smad dang rtsib logs g-yas g-yon dang / khong pa nang so so kun du nad kyis gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ro stod dang / ro smad dang rtsib logs g-yas g-yon dang / khong pa nang so so kun du nad kyis gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the upper body, the lower body, the right and left sides, and the entire interior of the abdomen become filled with illness.🔽The symptoms of that illness are a severe, chronic cough,

original: de'i nad thabs ni cham pas 'debs sprid pa rab tu drag po mang du 'byung /
analyzed: de'i nad thabs ni cham pas 'debs sprid pa rab tu drag po mang du 'byung /
translated: and much phlegm.

original: kha nas mchil ma dang bad kan mang du 'byung @110a * //🔽zhing 'dor / kha'i nang mngar /
analyzed: kha nas mchil ma dang bad kan mang du 'byung @110a * // zhing 'dor / kha'i nang mngar /
translated: Saliva and phlegm are frequently expelled from the mouth.🔽The mouth is sweet.

original: pho ba'i drod nyams /
analyzed: pho ba'i drod nyams /
translated: The heat of the stomach is diminished.

original: rdza ma dang / gzhong pa dang/ snod spyad la sogs pa kun dang / zas skom la sogs pa gtsang bar 'dug kyang btsog cing /
analyzed: rdza ma dang / gzhong pa dang/ snod spyad la sogs pa kun dang / zas skom la sogs pa gtsang bar 'dug kyang btsog cing /
translated: Even though pots, bowls, dishes, and so forth, as well as food and drink, and so forth, are clean, they appear dirty.

original: kha zas kyi nang du sbrang bu dang / rtsa dang skra la sogs pa song bar mthong /
analyzed: kha zas kyi nang du sbrang bu dang / rtsa dang skra la sogs pa song bar mthong /
translated: In the food, one sees insects, worms, hair, and so forth.

original: snying na / slon bro /
analyzed: snying na / slon bro /
translated: In the heart, there is a feeling of fullness and nausea.

original: zas yi gar mi 'ong /
analyzed: zas yi gar mi 'ong /
translated: One does not enjoy food.

original: kha zas rtag tu zos kyang nyams 'tshag zad /
analyzed: kha zas rtag tu zos kyang nyams 'tshag zad /
translated: Even though one always eats food, one is not satisfied.

original: lag pa rtag tu lta zhing lag ngar gyi mkhrig mar sbom phra 'jal 'dod /
analyzed: lag pa rtag tu lta zhing lag ngar gyi mkhrig mar sbom phra 'jal 'dod /
translated: One always looks at the hands and wants to measure the thickness of the wrist.

original: rkang pa dang gdong skrang /
analyzed: rkang pa dang gdong skrang /
translated: The feet and face swell.

original: mig dkar khral khral byed /
analyzed: mig dkar khral khral byed /
translated: The eyes roll around.

original: lus mthong na 'jigs su rung /
analyzed: lus mthong na 'jigs su rung /
translated: The body is terrifying to see.

original: snying la bud med 'dod /
analyzed: snying la bud med 'dod /
translated: In the heart, one desires a woman.

original: chang dang sha yi gar 'ong ba snyam byed /
analyzed: chang dang sha yi gar 'ong ba snyam byed /
translated: One thinks that beer and meat are delicious.

original: zos na skyug bro /
analyzed: zos na skyug bro /
translated: When one eats, one vomits.

original: klad pa'i spyi bo rtag tu 'gebs par byed /
analyzed: klad pa'i spyi bo rtag tu 'gebs par byed /
translated: One always covers the top of the head.

original: sen mo dang skra rab tu ring /
analyzed: sen mo dang skra rab tu ring /
translated: The nails and hair become very long.

original: rmi lam na phye ma leb dang / rtsangs pa dang / sdig sbrul dang / spre'u dang / gcan gzan dang / bya rnams kyis bdag la 'tshe bar mthong /
analyzed: rmi lam na phye ma leb dang / rtsangs pa dang / sdig sbrul dang / spre'u dang / gcan gzan dang / bya rnams kyis bdag la 'tshe bar mthong /
translated: In dreams, one sees butterflies, lizards, scorpions, monkeys, wild animals, and birds harming oneself.

original: skra dang rus pa dang / phub ma dang thal ba'i phung po la bdag 'dzeg cing 'gro bar rmi /
analyzed: skra dang rus pa dang / phub ma dang thal ba'i phung po la bdag 'dzeg cing 'gro bar rmi /
translated: One dreams of climbing and going to heaps of hair, bones, chaff, and ashes.

original: grong dang yul stong dang chu bo skams pa mthong /
analyzed: grong dang yul stong dang chu bo skams pa mthong /
translated: One sees empty towns and countries, and dry rivers.

original: skar ma ltung ba dang / ri bsgyel zhing lhung bar rmi lam du mthong la shing skyes pa kun 'bar bar mthong /
analyzed: skar ma ltung ba dang / ri bsgyel zhing lhung bar rmi lam du mthong la shing skyes pa kun 'bar bar mthong /
translated: One dreams of falling stars, mountains collapsing and falling, and all the trees growing ablaze.

original: gal te nad ro stong yan chad du rgyas na ni cham pas thebs /🔽dbugs mi bde /
analyzed: gal te nad ro stong yan chad du rgyas na ni cham pas thebs / dbugs mi bde /
translated: If the disease spreads from the upper body to the lower body, one catches a cold.🔽One has difficulty breathing.

original: lud pas bkar /🔽phrag pa na /
analyzed: lud pas bkar / phrag pa na /
translated: One coughs.🔽One has pain in the shoulders.

original: klad pa'i spyi bor na /
analyzed: klad pa'i spyi bor na /
translated: One has pain in the head and brain.

original: skad 'gag / zas yi gar mi 'ong ba de lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad 'gag / zas yi gar mi 'ong ba de lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: One loses one's voice, and food becomes unappetizing.

original: gal te ro smad man chad du nad dkyel chen ni yang na tshad par 'khru /
analyzed: gal te ro smad man chad du nad dkyel chen ni yang na tshad par 'khru /
translated: If the disease spreads from the lower body to the upper body, one has a fever and diarrhea.

original: yang na rtug skam du gyur te 'khren pas 'dogs so //
analyzed: yang na rtug skam du gyur te 'khren pas 'dogs so //
translated: Or one becomes constipated and has difficulty defecating.

original: gal te nang grol gyi nang du nad dkyel cher gyur na ni slon par byed do //
analyzed: gal te nang grol gyi nang du nad dkyel cher gyur na ni slon par byed do //
translated: If the disease spreads to the internal organs, it will be cured.

original: rtsib logs su nad babs na ni glo g-yas g-yon du thad kar zug cing na'o //
analyzed: rtsib logs su nad babs na ni glo g-yas g-yon du thad kar zug cing na'o //
translated: If the disease spreads to the sides, it will be a straight pain in the right and left lungs.

original: rus pa'i tshigs kyi nang du nad babs na ni rims nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rus pa'i tshigs kyi nang du nad babs na ni rims nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the disease spreads to the joints of the bones, it will be a fever.

original: de ltar nad gnod byed kyi glo gcong gi nad thabs rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa de ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nad gnod byed kyi glo gcong gi nad thabs rnam pa bcu gcig yod pa de ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Thus, there are eleven methods of treating the disease of lung consumption.

original: glo gcong gi nad thabs 'di lta bus btab pa la nad bla brnan gzhan gyis btab pa ni skad 'jer te 'gag / gre ba subs /
analyzed: glo gcong gi nad thabs 'di lta bus btab pa la nad bla brnan gzhan gyis btab pa ni skad 'jer te 'gag / gre ba subs /
translated: In the case of being afflicted by this kind of lung consumption, if another disease is superimposed, the voice will be hoarse and blocked, and the throat will be dry.

original: brang gi nu 'jing g-yas g-yon du zug cing na /
analyzed: brang gi nu 'jing g-yas g-yon du zug cing na /
translated: The right and left sides of the chest will ache and hurt.

original: kha glal / lus dang ro stod @110b brdung ba snyam byed de na /
analyzed: kha glal / lus dang ro stod @110b brdung ba snyam byed de na /
translated: The mouth will gape, and the body and upper torso will feel as if they are being beaten.

original: kha nas mchil ma dang / bad kan gyi bag 'dor ba mang /
analyzed: kha nas mchil ma dang / bad kan gyi bag 'dor ba mang /
translated: There will be a lot of saliva and phlegm coming out of the mouth.

original: pho ba'i drod nyams /
analyzed: pho ba'i drod nyams /
translated: The heat of the stomach will diminish.

original: kha nas rnag mnam pa de lta bu'i nad du 'gyur ba 'di ni bla brnan gyi nang thabs yin no //
analyzed: kha nas rnag mnam pa de lta bu'i nad du 'gyur ba 'di ni bla brnan gyi nang thabs yin no //
translated: The mouth will smell of pus. This kind of disease will occur. This is the internal method of superimposition.

original: de la glo gcong zad byed kyi nad ci las gyur pa'i bye brag so so'i dmigs kyang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la glo gcong zad byed kyi nad ci las gyur pa'i bye brag so so'i dmigs kyang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the specific visualizations for each of the different types of consumption diseases.

original: nad de lta bu la rlung las gyur pa'i shas chen glad pa na /
analyzed: nad de lta bu la rlung las gyur pa'i shas chen glad pa na /
translated: If the wind-related component of such a disease is dominant and is located in the brain,

original: rtsib logs su zug cing na /
analyzed: rtsib logs su zug cing na /
translated: there will be pain and a feeling of heaviness in the ribs.

original: mgul pa subs shing skad 'gags pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgul pa subs shing skad 'gags pa de lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The throat will be constricted and the voice will be hoarse.

original: de la mkhris pa rgyas te tsha ba'i nad kyi shas chen ni lag mthil dang rkang mthil tsha /
analyzed: de la mkhris pa rgyas te tsha ba'i nad kyi shas chen ni lag mthil dang rkang mthil tsha /
translated: If the bile-related component is dominant and the disease is hot, the palms and soles will be hot,

original: tshad pas rab tu 'khru /
analyzed: tshad pas rab tu 'khru /
translated: the body will be feverish,

original: khrag tu slon /
analyzed: khrag tu slon /
translated: blood will be vomited,

original: kha mnam / rims kyis 'debs so //
analyzed: kha mnam / rims kyis 'debs so //
translated: the mouth will be dry, and there will be a fever.

original: nad de la bad kan gyi shas chen ni zas yi gar mi 'ong /🔽slon / lud pas bkar /
analyzed: nad de la bad kan gyi shas chen ni zas yi gar mi 'ong / slon / lud pas bkar /
translated: If the phlegm-related component is dominant, food will be unappetizing,

original: mgo dang lus dang rkang lag lci /
analyzed: mgo dang lus dang rkang lag lci /
translated: vomiting will occur, and there will be a feeling of heaviness in the head, body, and limbs.

original: mchil ma dang bad kan mang du 'ong /
analyzed: mchil ma dang bad kan mang du 'ong /
translated: There will be an excess of saliva and phlegm,

original: cham pas 'debs /🔽dbugs mi bde /
analyzed: cham pas 'debs / dbugs mi bde /
translated: a cold will develop,🔽and there will be shortness of breath,

original: skad 'gag / pho ba'i drod nyams pa de lta bu'i nad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad 'gag / pho ba'i drod nyams pa de lta bu'i nad du 'gyur ro //
translated: a hoarse voice, and a loss of digestive heat.

original: nad de lta bus btab ste /
analyzed: nad de lta bus btab ste /
translated: Such a disease will develop.

original: gso dka' ba dang / sla ba'i bye brag tu lta ba ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad kun rgyas la pho ba'i drod ni nyams te chung /
analyzed: gso dka' ba dang / sla ba'i bye brag tu lta ba ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad kun rgyas la pho ba'i drod ni nyams te chung /
translated: When all the illnesses of wind, bile, and phlegm increase, the heat of the stomach declines and becomes weak.🔽When phlegm increases greatly, the illnesses of the stomach are blocked and cut off, and the doors of all the channels are also blocked.

original: bad kan cher skyes pas pho ba'i nad 'gags shing chod de rtsa thams cad kyi sgo yang 'gags nas lus kyi srog zungs bdun dang / bshad gci dang rdul dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan yan chad lus la yod pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyis drod chung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bad kan cher skyes pas pho ba'i nad 'gags shing chod de rtsa thams cad kyi sgo yang 'gags nas lus kyi srog zungs bdun dang / bshad gci dang rdul dang rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan yan chad lus la yod pa rnam pa bcu gsum gyis drod chung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: The thirteen aspects of the life-force constituents of the body, feces, urine, dust, wind, bile, and phlegm, and so on, that exist in the body become weak.

original: pho ba'i me drod des log par tsha zhing 'tshig par byed pas kha zas zos pa'i bcud de zhu bar ma byas pas khrag dang sha la sogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: pho ba'i me drod des log par tsha zhing 'tshig par byed pas kha zas zos pa'i bcud de zhu bar ma byas pas khrag dang sha la sogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since that heat of the stomach fire wrongly burns and burns, the essence of the food that is eaten is not digested, and it does not become blood, flesh, and so on.

original: kha zas zos pa'i bcud de bad kan du gyur nas slar khang 'byung bar byed /
analyzed: kha zas zos pa'i bcud de bad kan du gyur nas slar khang 'byung bar byed /
translated: The essence of the food that is eaten becomes phlegm and is expelled again.

original: kha zas lto na yod pa yang zhu zhing bcud du 'gyur ba ni mi byed kyi dri ma bshad gci thur du 'gro ste /
analyzed: kha zas lto na yod pa yang zhu zhing bcud du 'gyur ba ni mi byed kyi dri ma bshad gci thur du 'gro ste /
translated: The food in the stomach is digested, but it does not become nutritious. Instead, the waste products are excreted as urine and feces.

original: de lta bas khrag dang sha la sogs pa lus kyi sro gzungs nyams 'tshag tu brta bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta bas khrag dang sha la sogs pa lus kyi sro gzungs nyams 'tshag tu brta bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, the body’s flesh and so forth do not become nourished.

original: kha zas ma zhu ba bcud du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: kha zas ma zhu ba bcud du mi 'gyur /
translated: Food that is not digested does not become nutritious.

original: bcud du ma gyur na khrag tu mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bcud du ma gyur na khrag tu mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is not nutritious, it does not become blood.

original: sha la sogs pa'i srog zungs su ga la 'gyur te /🔽lto ba'i nang na bshad gci 'ba' zhig gi tshogs @111a * //
analyzed: sha la sogs pa'i srog zungs su ga la 'gyur te / lto ba'i nang na bshad gci 'ba' zhig gi tshogs @111a * //
translated: How could it become the body’s flesh and so forth?

original: kyis lus rgyas te /
analyzed: kyis lus rgyas te /
translated: In the stomach, the body is nourished by a collection of only urine and feces.

original: de'i phyir lus sha kun ni med par gyur pas na zad byed kyi nad glo gcod zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus sha kun ni med par gyur pas na zad byed kyi nad glo gcod zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since all the body’s flesh is gone, the disease is called “consumption.”

original: nad thabs 'di ltar sna ma tshang ste /
analyzed: nad thabs 'di ltar sna ma tshang ste /
translated: This disease is not curable.

original: dkyel  chung yang nad pa'i nyams 'tshag chung ste /
analyzed: dkyel  chung yang nad pa'i nyams 'tshag chung ste /
translated: Even if the patient is given a little food, he cannot digest it.

original: sman btang mi bzod pa dang na nas yun ring ba de lta bu ni snan  btang mi bzod de gsor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sman btang mi bzod pa dang na nas yun ring ba de lta bu ni snan  btang mi bzod de gsor mi rung ngo //
translated: If he is given medicine, he cannot tolerate it. If he becomes ill for a long time, he cannot tolerate the medicine. He is incurable.

original: nad thabs 'di ltar na nas ring po ma lon pa nyams 'tshag gis thub ste /
analyzed: nad thabs 'di ltar na nas ring po ma lon pa nyams 'tshag gis thub ste /
